tool.help:
Summary: This workflow runs tophat and cufflink for up to 4 groups of samples, merge the assembled with cuffmerge, and finally compare the groups pairwisely with cuffdiff. This protocol was described in Trapnell et al. Differential gene and transcript expression analysis of RNA-seq experiments with TopHat and Cufflinks. Nat Protoc. 2012 7(3): 562â€“578
Each group can have multiple samples. The input must be paired ended (PE) fastq files for each sample.
For each sample, the workflow run the following process: 1. QC, the low quality reads will be removed and low quality bases will be trimmed 2. tophat, high quality reads will be mapped to the selected genome 3. cufflink, assemble the transcripts
For all the samples together, the workflow run: 1. cuffmerge, merge the transcripts
For any pair of groups, the workflow run: 1. cuffdiff, compare the transcripts between the two groups (e.g. case and control)
Input: 1. select the reference genome 2. PE fastq files (2 files) for each sample click "add new FASTQ file for sample" to add a new sample select a group for the sample and give a unique sample name
Output: 1. accepted_hits.bam, align_summary.txt, deletions.bed, insertions.bed, junctions.bed, unmapped.bam for each sample from tophat 2. transcripts.gtf, genes.fpkm_tracking, isoforms.fpkm_tracking for each sample from cufflink 3. merged.gtf from cuffmerge 4. gene_exp.diff, genes.count_tracking, genes.fpkm_tracking, genes.read_group_tracking and many others for two groups from cuffdiff
